history.content: I'm taking it right now (with Wagner+Popa) and the TAs who are teaching it over the summer are really awesome! I know they are thinking about having the Gradescope homework assignments allow immediate feedback (aka you know whether you got a full score before submitting the assignment), which is not usually the case over semester. I don't know much more than that, the projects should be similar (proj3 is a new project this semester, and they might use it for the summer as well--it's a pretty fun project too). Not sure about the exams but it'll probably just be like the normal 2 midterms 1 final. The instructors may be able to answer if they see this. It's not a really heavy CS course in particular (besides maybe when you have proj2 which is somewhat more time-consuming), so the summer version shouldn't be too bad.

children.subject: I'm interested in taking the class this summer and I'm in favor of the 8 shorter hw assignments particularly since we're online I'd like to have more instant feedback.

A normal 161 semester usually has three main workload components: project, exam, homework.

The projects over the summer will be the same as a fall/spring semester. This probably includes a new project 3 we introduced this semester, although the TA who developed that project won't be on staff over the summer so we may have to revert to the old project 3 if something goes horribly wrong on the backend and no one knows how to fix it. Hopefully that won't be the case, though.

We haven't settled on how we're doing online exams yet. It'll probably depend on whatever campus directives about proctoring we get between now and the start of the semester. Sorry I don't have a clearer answer about this yet, but we'll keep you posted.

The homework is the one component I wanted to change significantly over the summer to incorporate more instant feedback (like 61C/188 style Gradescope assignments where you see the answer right after submitting), and now that everything is online, this is almost definitely going to happen. Ideally I'd like to remove the 3-4 psets of a normal fall/spring semester in favor of 8 shorter homework assignments (1 per week over the summer) where you get instant feedback on the first half of the assignment but not on the second half. If it goes well maybe we'll even keep this format for future fall/spring semesters.

tl;dr even though it's online we plan to teach all the same material as a fall/spring semester, give or take some logistical changes on exams and a new experimental homework format that was happening anyway.

Generally speaking, I would think of a summer technical as the equivalent workload of taking two technicals during a normal semester since it's twice as fast. I would personally rate 161 as a medium-workload technical compared to other CS classes.

I wouldn't recommend doing both for most people, but many are more than capable of doing it. Just be ready for a decent amount of work.
How heavy would the workload be over summer?? I want to take it but I’ll also be doing a summer internship remotely, but wanted to know if it would be doable.

history.content: Hello, I was wondering how the material + projects done during the summer, and now online, version of 161 compares to normal semester 161 with Weaver. I want to make sure I get to learn all the concepts and do all the similar projects to get everything out of the class. Thanks!
history.subject: Summer 161 vs Semester 161
